alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin; Sherburne; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hennepin, east central Wright, west central Anoka and southeastern Sherburne Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Lake, or 15 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elk River around 450 PM CDT. Albertville around 500 PM CDT. St. Michael around 505 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Otsego and Rogers. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 197 and 205. U.S. Highway 10 in Minnesota between mile markers 204 and 217. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 159 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
